conclusion: Springs do not stretch when current is I1, indicating magnetic and gravitational forces are balanced.
When current is I2 and direction is reversed, magnetic force acts in opposite direction causing springs to stretch.
Magnetic force Fm is given by Fm = BIL.
Magnetic force equals gravitational force when springs do not stretch: Fm = mg.
With current I2, magnetic force is Fm' = BIL.
Elongation of springs calculated using Hooke's Law: F = kx.
Force on springs is difference between magnetic force and gravitational force: F = Fm' - mg.
Substitute values to find force: F = BIL - mg.
Solve for elongation x: x = (BIL - mg) / k.
Elongation of the springs is x = (BIL - mg) / k.
